text: Eaters still dancing!
author: EliStokols

text: An early #FF to @mollymotoole, who is routinely breaking news on the border beat.
author: EliStokols

text: Okay, cool. But he's likely not announcing until April.
author: EliStokols

text:
"Sunset pushed the denizens of the Sightseer Lounge to the brink of insanity, as all but the Amish frantically tried to capture the flame-colored sky on our cellphone cameras."

There is no reason to cross the US by train. But @caityweaver did it anyway.
author: EliStokols

text: "At the same time, she aggressively prosecuted smaller offenses such as vandalism and routinely sought longer-than-recommended sentences, including for minors."
author: EliStokols

text: Similar reaction just now from @SRuhle, who said she took the @Hickenlooper comment as a “hat tip” to all the women running “by a guy who probably does the sprinkler on the dance floor.”
author: EliStokols

text: "So I took my mother to see 'Deep Throat'" is -- of course! -- how this Hickenlooper town hall is going to come to an end.
author: EliStokols

text:
Oh boy. Asked if he'd put a woman on the ticket, Hickenlooper says "of course." 

But he keeps going: "Why don't you ask the women if they'd put a man on the ticket?"
author: EliStokols

text: Hickenlooper: "I can't wait for Donald Trump to make up nicknames for me."
author: EliStokols

text: If the Hickenlooper town hall started with this block, he'd be off to a strong night. Showing some humor and now some emotional resolve recalling the Aurora theater shooting and CO's response. Looks far more comfortable than the first 15 minutes.
author: EliStokols

text: Hickenlooper explains his opposition to single-payer healthcare, but says "there needs to be a public option" and that he believes "healthcare is a right."
author: EliStokols

text: Hickenlooper on criminal justice: "Our system of incarceration is a dramatic failure."
author: EliStokols

text: .@Hickenlooper in CNN Town Hall: "I would not ask the federal government to legalize [marijuana] for everyone...but when states legalize...the federal government should get out of the way."
author: EliStokols

text: Since all the Beto coverage last fall and after, I've thought of MSNBC segments as a decent barometer of what's selling to progressives. Not sure if that's true, but I just saw something new: a whole @DeadlineWH segment built around @PeteButtigieg.
author: EliStokols

text: Trump holds up the 8x11 papers with the economic numbers again: "Look at that chart. You don't have to know what's on it, what difference does it make?"
author: EliStokols

text: Also worth noting that Fox has taken none of this Trump speech live, but Shep Smith did cut in to play the tape of his McCain rant.
author: EliStokols

text:
Trump is holding up charts (on 8X11 copy paper) in Lima, OH claiming 3% GDP growth and that the news distorts it downward. 

Less than two hours ago, the Fed downgraded their growth estimate for this year to to 2.1% from the 2.3% projection made in December.
author: EliStokols

text: Worth noting that, unlike at most of his rallies, the crowd inside this factory sounded pretty quiet as Trump went after McCain. He went on despite getting little encouragement from within the room.
author: EliStokols

text:
TRUMP STILL BASHING MCCAIN in Lima, OH factory: "I gave him the kind of funeral that he wanted, which I had to approve." 

He blames media for making him talk about this: "Not my kind of guy but some people like him and I think that's great," he concludes.
author: EliStokols

text: The segue to this subject was a familiar one: "A lot of people are asking me...about a man named John McCain."
author: EliStokols

text: Always with the size hang-up.
author: EliStokols

text: Reminder that the Army doesn't want the tanks this plant is building and Ohio's manufacturing economy continues to be hurt by Trump's trade war:
author: EliStokols

text: "Well you better love me, I kept this place open" is how Trump begins after pacing the stage in front of massive tanks  inside the Lima, OH plant while 'God Bless the USA' played in its entirety.
author: EliStokols

text: Big congrats to @JimPuzzanghera, a classy, talented journalist and fun officemate, on being named the next DC bureau chief at the Boston Globe. Not sure who will listen to my long rants about the NFL now (perhaps @Noahbierman?) Sorry to see you go.
author: EliStokols

text:
Trump says China "deal is coming along nicely" and on tariffs: "for a period of time that will stay."

On his tweeting: "I think Twitter is a way I get out the word when we have a corrupt media."

And scene.
author: EliStokols

text:
Trump calls Mueller "Comey's best friend."

"You have a great victory and someone comes in and writes a report. who never got a vote!"

"With all of that being said, I look forward to seeing the report."
author: EliStokols

text:
Trump on Mueller: "A man gets appointed by his deputy, he writes a report. I never figured that one out...

"Now somebody's going to write a report who never got a vote..." 

"My voters don't get it." 

He says Mueller is writing the report "out of the blue."
author: EliStokols

text: Good @theodoricmeyer piece here on two Dem contenders long at odds over banks and bankruptcy laws >
author: EliStokols

text: The people briefing him figured out long ago that he does like visual illustrations.
author: EliStokols

text: For context: "Netanyahu has been keen to stress his strong relationship with Trump, who recognized Jerusalem as Israel’s capital and moved the U.S. Embassy there. Huge campaign billboards alongside Israeli highways show the two men shaking hands."
author: EliStokols

text:
.@PressSec: "President Donald J. Trump will welcome Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel to the White House from March 25 to 26, 2019."

Israel's election is April 9.
author: EliStokols

text: .@Hickenlooper will meet with @staceyabrams in Atlanta today and tour a community health center ahead of tonight's CNN town hall there.
author: EliStokols

text: Overshadowed by Betomania: In a nationalized political landscape dominated by political celebrities, Klobuchar’s midwestern roots may mean less in Iowa.
author: EliStokols

text: Yesterday’s tweet prompted such helpful news coverage, why not extend the news cycle on this another day...
author: EliStokols

text: It’s somewhat similar to the conundrum GOP candidates faced in 2016 w Trump, who proved all but impossible to knock down. Difference being: Trump baited them with blunt insults; Beto is neutralizing them with bland compliments.
author: EliStokols

text: I can see it going this way for a while, with everyone who goes after Beto only making him stronger while making themselves look small.
author: EliStokols

text: No, it’s tomorrow.

text: Trump and Bolsonaro expressed lofty hopes of leading Venezuela toward democracy — while puckishly denigrating a key democratic pillar, the press.

text:
Winning a Republican seat in Orange County is hard enough for a Democrat. Holding it is a whole different matter.

@sarahdwire on the early -- and very different -- calculations of four freshmen Dems from the OC.

text: Trump adds: "I'm very proud to hear the president use the term fake news."

text: Trump, responding to a Q about the Nunes lawsuit: "We have to do something" about social media." Says social media "discrimination" against conservatives "is collusive."
author: EliStokols

text: Trump, asked what else he's willing to do since efforts so far have failed to oust Maduro, only mentions "tougher sanctions... We can be a lot tougher if we need to do that."

text: Bolsonaro in the Rose Garden: "Brazil and the United States stand side by side...against fake news."

text: This is less than 24 hours after he claimed that he hadn’t lobbied Senate Rs to oppose the resolution terminating his national emergency, which was also false. He really can’t stand to be rebuked/humiliated.
author: EliStokols

text: Trying hard to whitewash over another rebuke by Republicans in Congress, and therein telegraphing how much it actually irks him >>

text: Ubiquity! I think he’s got that nailed.

text: Trump just claimed to reporters that he didn't put pressure on lawmakers to oppose the measure. Mmmk.

text:
From latest WH pool report:

Reporter: "You see rising white nationalism?"

Trump: “I don't really, I think it’s a small group of people.”
author: EliStokols

text: Trump issues first veto, defying Congress’ rebuke of his border emergency order
author: EliStokols

text: Trump issues first veto of his presidency: “Today I am vetoing this resolution. Congress has the freedom to pass this resolution and I have the duty to veto it.”
author: EliStokols

text: Also, that story on the 'Beto backlash' over his media coverage sits in the lede slot on Politico's site -- right above a second story about Beto.

text:
'Not one woman got that kind of coverage.' 

Very true. 

Not one man running on the Dem side has either.
